title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the Short Title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the establishment for American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian culture and arts development under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in section 2(a)(4). Tribally controlled community colleges are defined by the Tribally Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 as post-secondary vocational institutions. The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is defined by the Tribally Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. SEC. 3. Land grant status for tribally controlled community colleges and tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. Land grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, shall be considered land-grant colleges. The applicability of related provisions applies to any provision of any Act. Land grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts under the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, are considered land-grant colleges. Related provisions of Acts apply to these colleges in the United States and its territories. The provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, regarding donations of public land for the endowment and maintenance of colleges, apply to land-grant colleges and institutions in the United States and its territories. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be held and considered granted to such colleges and institutions subject to the Act of July 2, 1862, for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts, authorizing an appropriation of $10,000,000 to tribal colleges and institutions. Amounts appropriated under this section are granted to tribal colleges and institutions in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862, for the benefit of agriculture and mechanic arts. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". The term "1994 Institutions" in the Act refers to a list of specific colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, and Standing Rock College. The list of 1994 Institutions includes Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges apply to 1994 Institutions in the same manner, with some exceptions. The provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges apply to 1994 Institutions in the same manner, with some exceptions. This subsection does not apply to Acts assisting agricultural research at eligible colleges under specific Acts of Congress. In lieu of extending provisions of Acts related to land-grant colleges to 1994 Institutions, $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for them. Amounts granted are subject to provisions applicable to proceeds from land sales. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions by authorizing appropriations for payment on behalf of these institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to authorize appropriations of $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions, distributed through a competitive applications process. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to authorize annual appropriations of $5,000,000 for 1994 Institutions through a competitive applications process. Matching funds are not required for funds under subsection (b)(3). The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to authorize annual appropriations of $5,000,000 for 1994 Institutions for research facilities. Matching funds are not required for these funds. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. Subsections are also redesignated in section 4. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 for grants to 1994 Institutions for constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. Subsections are also redesignated in section 4. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
